p: The MNPs design, particularly related to their physical and chemical properties, can be controlled to fit different biomedical applications, allowing an accurate control of their spatial, temporal, and dosage distribution [ 1]. The increasing interest in nanomedicine has aroused a special focus on fabrication protocols for high-performance IONPs, for obtaining not only the desired physicochemical properties, such as: Morphology, size, and structure, but also a good biocompatibility [ 67, 68].
